citations.narrative:
Records of administration of anti-parasitic medications for intestinal parasites were not maintained for adult dogs sold and
held by the licensee. The written Program of Veterinary Care, signed and dated 6/28/2023, required that pregnant
females receive fenbendazole (Pyrantel or Safeguard) once at the time of whelping. The licensee stated that she has
been administering the fenbendazole to her adult dogs at the time of whelping, as described in the Program of Veterinary
Care; however, she has not been documenting this activity.
Medical records are essential for APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of medical care provided by the facility and
ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, and illness.
The licensee must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These
records must include routine husbandry procedures (such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, and
treatments) performed an all animals.
To be corrected by the close of business on 11/29/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Records of administration of anti-parasitic medications for intestinal parasites were not maintained for adult dogs sold and 
held by the licensee. The written Program of Veterinary Care, signed and dated 6/28/2023, required that pregnant 
females receive fenbendazole (Pyrantel or Safeguard) once at the time of whelping. The licensee stated that she has 
been administering the fenbendazole to her adult dogs at the time of whelping, as described in the Program of Veterinary 
Care; however, she has not been documenting this activity. 
 
Medical records are essential for APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of medical care provided by the facility and 
ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, and illness. 
 
The licensee must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These 
records must include routine husbandry procedures (such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, and 
treatments) performed an all animals.  
 
To be corrected by the close of business on 11/29/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
